feature_1.title: DCWine, the Passion
feature_1.subtitle: Wine is defined as a cultural and historical product, something that has always been present in all areas of our lives, whether through gastronomy, agriculture or simply in the most recreational events. The origin of wine is very ancient and closely linked to the development of man. Present in all civilizations. Wine is also connected to the idea of ​​celebrating; an event, a moment, a special date, an achievement, a reunion, a love.

feature_2.title: El Prosecco
feature_2.subtitle: The hills of Prosecco di Conegliano and Valdobbiadene have been declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO (July 7, 2018) due to the exceptional universal value of the Veneto landscape, these hills represent the world of Italian prosecco: thirty kilometers of steep slopes covered with vineyards, thanks to the climate and terrain that facilitate their production. Here Prosecco DeGiusti is born, a quality product, available in three variants.

feature_3.title: El Biológico
feature_3.subtitle: The word BIO from Latin means 'Life', Life that generates Life. An organic wine is one whose production is free of artificial or harmful chemicals for the vineyards or the people who work in them. To obtain a wine certified as organic, the vine and the field must be cared for for a period of more than four years. Anyone who produces organic wine deserves applause, because they are not thinking only of themselves or the present moment; .

about_us_page.meta_description: Discover the story behind DcWine, our passion for quality wines, and why we believe in bringing the best wine experience to you.
about_us_page.title: The best wine shop
about_us_page.subtitle: lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipiscing elit lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipiscing elit lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipiscing elit lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipiscing elit
about_us_page.first_paragraph:
Born in 2018, based in Lanzarote, developing a project studied and prepared to satisfy the highest level client. That's how we started, looking for qualified references and wineries that had the same objectives as us.

We are all related to wine in some way or another, we comment on it, we celebrate in its name, we drink it, we toast it and finally we enjoy each glass with which we pair different types of foods that accompany it. Around it, we build and celebrate occasions that become unique experiences and unforgettable memories that remain engraved in our memory, but do we know what wine is?
about_us_page.second_paragraph:
Let's define wine as the result of the fermentation of grape must. We call must the juice that is obtained as a result of crushing the grapes, that is, when they are crushed and the juice is obtained that rests in large tanks, usually made of stainless steel and that have a controlled temperature, which allows the fermentation process to begin where the sugar is transformed into alcohol.

To know the different classifications and types of wine there are many criteria, but I recommend using our senses to be able to classify them in an intuitive and natural way.
about_us_page.third_paragraph:
1. Slows Aging
According to Harvard Medical School, resveratrol, a compound found in the skin of red grapes, slows aging when consumed in moderation. It is believed to be one of the reasons for longevity in regions with high red wine consumption, such as southwest France or Sardinia.

2. Aids in Weight Loss
Red wine activates a gene that prevents the formation of new fat cells while stimulating existing ones to cleanse and gradually eliminate them. To see this effect on your figure, remember not to drink more than one glass per day. Obviously, the results will be more visible if accompanied by a balanced diet.

3. Boosts Brain Function
Many studies show that drinking red wine moderately but consistently helps prevent dementia and degenerative brain diseases.

4. Treats Gum Infections
If you suffer from bleeding gums, don't hesitate to accompany your meals with a small glass of red wine. There are compounds present in grapes that, when fermented into wine, help prevent the appearance of streptococci and bacteria linked to cavities. It is also very effective against gingivitis.

5. Protects Against Severe Sunburn
According to scientists from the University of Barcelona, flavonoids found in grapes and wine help reduce the harmful effects of ultraviolet rays on the skin.

6. Fights Fatigue
A study published in The FASEB Journal states that resveratrol, present in grapes, improves our condition on days when we feel more apathetic or tired.

7. Increases Endorphins
According to a study conducted by the University of California, enjoying a rich and healthy glass of wine releases endorphins in our body, helping us relax and enjoy the moment.

8. Cleanses the Palate
It may seem curious, but drinking wine while eating enhances the intensity of flavors thanks to its astringent properties. It reduces the taste of fats and provides a gratifying sensation by cleansing the mouth.
about_us_page.fourth_paragraph:
9. Good for Lowering Cholesterol
Red wine is a natural treasure rich in polyphenols, one of which is the well-known resveratrol. This antioxidant-rich chemical, according to the Mayo Clinic, helps protect blood vessels by preventing clot formation and reducing bad cholesterol.

10. Reduces the Risk of Depression
A study conducted by several Spanish universities with over 5,500 men and women aged 55 to 80 analyzed their drinking habits and found that those who consumed between two and seven glasses of wine per week were less likely to be diagnosed with depression.

11. Excellent for Heart Health
In addition to the polyphenols mentioned earlier, red wine is rich in vitamin E, which helps cleanse the blood and blood vessels, protecting cardiovascular health.

12. Reduces Cancer Risk
As a powerful antioxidant, red wine is a natural resource capable of blocking the growth of cells responsible for breast or lung cancer.

13. Prevents Diseases That Cause Blindness
According to scientists from Washington University School of Medicine, wine can stop the process known as angiogenesis (the formation of new blood vessels in the eye area), which leads to blindness.

14. Increases Omega-3 Fatty Acid Levels
A study conducted by researchers from several European countries analyzing adult dietary habits found that moderate red wine drinkers had higher levels of Omega-3 fatty acids in their blood.

15. Fights Urinary Infections
Thanks to its antioxidant and astringent properties, red wine prevents bacteria from adhering to the bladder or kidneys, optimizing the filtration and purification of these organs.
about_us_page.last_paragraph: Now that you know the true story of DCWine, let's raise a glass together!

privacy_policy_page.information_and_consent_description: In accordance with the provisions of the EU General Data Protection Regulation 679/2016 ('RGPD') and Organic Law 3/2018, of December 5, on Data Protection and Guarantee of Digital Rights ('LOPDGDD'), by accepting this Privacy Policy, the interested party (the 'Interested Party') GIVES HIS/HER informed, express, free and unequivocal CONSENT to process the personal data collected through the Website, either through forms enabled for this purpose or through the information collected by cookies. Likewise, the Interested Party consents to this data being processed by the Controller to provide its services by applying the organizational and security measures required by the RGPD. All personal data requested from the Interested Party on the Website are mandatory, and it is not possible to provide the service without the corresponding data processing by the Controller. However, browsing the Website is free. The Interested Party guarantees that the personal data provided to the Controller are true and accurate, and therefore the Controller shall not be liable for any incident arising from the inaccuracy or falsity of the information provided by the Interested Party, beyond the Interested Party's possibility of exercising their right to rectification. In the event that the Interested Party provides us with data of third parties, as the controller or processor, they shall be responsible for complying with all applicable data protection regulations. Furthermore, the Interested Party guarantees that they have obtained all legally required consents, authorisations and/or approvals before including personal data of third parties on the Website.
privacy_policy_page.table_origin_description: From the Interested Party itself through the sending of communications to the email address indicated on the Website, as well as through its telephone helpline.
privacy_policy_page.table_legal_description: General Data Protection Regulation, in particular: Art 6.1 b): request for pre-contractual measures.
privacy_policy_page.table_treatment_description: Attend to and respond to queries requested by the Interested Party and to their requests.
privacy_policy_page.table_data_category_description: Personal data, shipping data, billing data.
privacy_policy_page.table_recipients_description: Transfer to third parties is not planned, except under legal obligation.
privacy_policy_page.table_international_description: International data transfer is not planned.
privacy_policy_page.table_storage_description: The data will be kept until the interested party withdraws his/her consent or the purpose for which it was collected has ended, unless the data must be kept due to a legal obligation.
privacy_policy_page.data_of_the_interested_party_description: The Interested Party guarantees that he/she is over eighteen (18) years of age and that the data provided is true, accurate, complete and up to date, and is responsible for any direct or indirect damage or harm that may be caused as a result of failure to comply with such obligation, beyond the Interested Party's ability to exercise his/her right to rectification. In the event that the data provided belongs to a third party, the Interested Party guarantees that he/she has informed said third party of the aspects contained in this document and obtained his/her authorization to provide his/her data to the controller for the purposes indicated above. The Controller cannot guarantee the absolute invulnerability of the systems, therefore, he/she does not assume any responsibility for damages and harm derived from alterations that third parties may cause in computer systems, electronic documents or files.
privacy_policy_page.cookies_policy_description: In accordance with the provisions of the GDPR and Law 34/2002 on Information Society Services, all personal data obtained through cookies during the use of the Website will be treated in accordance with the provisions of the Cookies Policy
privacy_policy_page.exercise_of_rights_description: In accordance with the provisions of the GDPR, we inform you that you can exercise your rights of access, rectification, deletion, opposition, data portability and limitation of processing directly with the Controller. To exercise these rights, the Interested Party may send a message to this effect, indicating name, surname, email, ID or passport number, to the following email address: lanzarotedcwine@gmail.com. The Interested Party may also exercise their rights by filing a claim with the Data Controller.
privacy_policy_page.acceptance_of_the_privacy_policy_descrip: The Interested Party ACKNOWLEDGES AND ACCEPTS HAVING READ AND UNDERSTOOD this Privacy Policy, the content of which constitutes the entire agreement between the Interested Party and the Controller regarding the use and processing of their personal information. The Interested Party expressly agrees to be bound by the terms of this Privacy Policy, in its full extent and scope, without excluding any of its provisions. The express acceptance of this Privacy Policy is essential when the Interested Party registers through the Website by filling out the corresponding registration form.

terms_and_conditions_page.meta_description: Read our Terms and Conditions to understand the rules and guidelines for using our website, including payment, shipping, and refund policies. Stay informed and shop with confidence.
terms_and_conditions_page.title: Terms and Conditions
terms_and_conditions_page.first_paragraph:
We ask that you read our Terms and Conditions carefully, since by using our services you are agreeing to comply with the provisions set forth herein.

Scope of the Contract

Our Terms and Conditions govern all commercial transactions carried out in our online store and apply to all consumers who may receive deliveries in the Canary Islands. The Website is primarily aimed at Users residing in the Canary Islands, Spain. DCWine does not ensure that the Website complies with the laws of other countries, either in whole or in part. DCWine declines all liability that may arise from such access, nor does it ensure shipments outside the Canary Islands. We reserve the right to cancel any order that we suspect is fraudulent, speculative or made in bad faith. If it could reasonably be considered that a purchase of this nature has been made, it could be cancelled and the relevant authorities would be informed. The User declares to be over 18 years of age and to have the legal capacity to enter into contracts through this Website. The User must also provide true and lawful contact information, such as an email address, postal address and/or other information. The User may, at his/her discretion, formalize with DCWine the contract of sale of the desired products in any of the languages ​​in which these Terms and Conditions are available on this Website. For the purposes of these Terms and Conditions, it is understood that the activity that DCWine carries out through the Website includes: - Sale of wines. In addition to reading these Terms and Conditions, before accessing, browsing and/or using this website, the User must have read the Legal Notice, the Cookies Policy, and the Privacy and Data Protection Policy of DCWine. By using this Website or by making and/or requesting the purchase of a product through it, the User agrees to be bound by these Conditions and by all of the above, so if you do not agree with all of this, you should not use this Website. Likewise, you are informed that these Terms and Conditions may be modified. The User is responsible for consulting them each time he/she accesses, browses and/or uses the Website, since those that are in force at the time when the acquisition of products and/or services is requested will be applicable. For all questions that the User may have in relation to these Terms and Conditions, he/she may contact the owner using the contact information provided in the Legal Notice, where applicable, using the contact form.

Purchase process

Users can purchase on the Website by the established means and forms. They must follow the online purchase and/or acquisition procedure of www.dcwinecanarias.com, during which various products can be selected and added to the cart, basket or final purchase space and, finally, click on: 'Buy'. Likewise, the User must fill in and/or check the information requested at each step, although, during the purchase process, before making the payment, the purchase data can be modified. Once the purchase procedure has been completed, the User agrees that the Website will generate an electronic invoice that will be sent to the User via email. Likewise, the User may, if he or she so wishes, obtain a copy of his or her invoice in paper form, by requesting it from DCWine using the contact spaces on the Website or through the contact details provided in the Legal Notice. The User acknowledges that he or she is aware, at the time of purchase, of certain particular conditions of sale that concern the product in question and that are shown next to the presentation or, where applicable, image of it on its page on the Website, indicating, by way of example, but not exhaustive, and depending on each case: name, price, components, weight, quantity, colour, details of the products, or characteristics; and acknowledges that placing the purchase order materialises the full and complete acceptance of the particular conditions of sale applicable to each case. Communications, purchase orders and payments involved in transactions carried out on the Website may be archived and kept in DCWine's computerized records in order to constitute a means of proof of the transactions, in any case, respecting reasonable security conditions and the laws and regulations in force that are applicable in this regard, and particularly taking into account Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council, of April 27, 2016, regarding the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and the free circulation of these data (RGPD) and Organic Law 3/2018,of December 5, on the Protection of Personal Data and the guarantee of digital rights, and the rights that assist Users in accordance with the privacy policy of this Website.

Prices and payments

We offer various forms of payment for your convenience, including: debit or credit card through a virtual POS. DCWine uses all means to guarantee the confidentiality and security of the payment data transmitted by the User during transactions through the Website. As such, the Website uses a secure SSL (Secure Socket Layer) payment system. Credit cards will be subject to checks and authorizations by the issuing bank.If the entity does not authorize the payment, DCWine will not be responsible for any delay or lack of delivery and will not be able to enter into any contract with the User. It is important to bear in mind that providers or issuers of payment methods may apply anti-fraud measures, so we are not responsible for these security policies. Once DCWine receives the purchase order from the User through the Website, a pre-authorization will be made on the corresponding card to ensure that there are sufficient funds to complete the transaction. The charge on the credit card will be made at the time that the confirmation of the completion of your order is sent to you.

Orders

All purchase orders received by DCWine through the Website are subject to the availability of the products and/or that no circumstance or cause of force majeure (Exoneration of Liability) affects the supply of the same.

Shipping Conditions

We only ship within the Canary Islands. Shipping costs will be calculated based on the destination and the total of your purchase, and will be detailed during the purchase process for your review before completing the transaction. Delivery time varies depending on order demand and stock availability. It may vary depending on workload and other logistical factors. Shipments do not have insurance by default. If you wish to insure your shipment, you can purchase optional insurance during the purchase process. We are not responsible for delays in delivery due to circumstances beyond our control or fortuitous events. Deliveries will be made within the following territory: Canary Islands. DCWine is exonerated from any liability arising from the transport of the products. If the User is not going to be at the place of delivery in the agreed time slot, he/she must contact us.

Additional shipping costs: In the event that the courier company makes a second or third delivery attempt, additional costs may be generated. These costs, if applied, will be billed to the customer. DCWine is exonerated from any liability arising from these additional costs, which are managed directly by the courier company and are subject to its general conditions. If it were impossible to deliver the order due to the User's absence, the order could be returned to the warehouse. However, the carrier would leave a notice explaining where the order is and how to have it delivered again. For the purposes of these Conditions, delivery will be deemed to have taken place or the order to have been delivered when the User or a third party indicated by the User acquires material possession of the products, which will be accredited by signing for receipt of the order at the agreed delivery address. The User acquires ownership of the products when DCWine receives full payment for all amounts due in relation to the purchase made.

Technical means to correct errors

The User is hereby informed that if he or she detects that an error has occurred when entering the data necessary to process his or her purchase request on the Website, he or she may modify said data by contacting DCWine through the contact spaces enabled on the Website and, where appropriate, through those enabled to contact customer service, and/or using the contact details provided in the Legal Notice. In any case, before clicking on 'Buy', the User has access to the space, cart, or basket where their purchase requests are recorded and can make modifications. Likewise, the User is referred to consult the Legal Notice and, specifically, the Privacy Policy to gather more information on how to exercise their right to rectification as established in Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council, of April 27, 2016, regarding the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and the free circulation of these data (RGPD) and in Organic Law 3/2018, of December 5, on the Protection of Personal Data and guarantee of digital rights.

Exchanges and Returns

We reserve the right to accept exchanges and returns. If you receive a defective product, you must notify us without undue delay and, in any case, within a maximum period of 48 hours. In the case of exchanges, the refund will not be made in cash, but the amount will be refunded to the same card with which the purchase was made. Your satisfaction is our priority. If you have received a defective product, please contact us at food@dadilogistica.com and we will respond to your request within a maximum period of 10 days, offering you an appropriate solution. We are not responsible for damage to products made due to circumstances beyond our control or fortuitous events. In the case of incorrect products being sent, the corresponding amount will be refunded to the same card with which the purchase was made. The User acknowledges that, in the event of withdrawal, he/she must assume the direct cost of the return (transport, delivery) of the goods, except in the case of defective, damaged or incorrectly delivered products, in which case the costs will be assumed by DCWine. However, if the cost of the return is manifestly disproportionate to the value of the product (for example, when the cost of transport greatly exceeds the price paid), the User may contact DCWine to negotiate a solution to reduce these costs, always in compliance with consumer and user protection regulations. Likewise, the User accepts that, if at the time of delivery he considers that the product does not comply with the provisions of the contract or the purchase order (due to defect or error), he must immediately notify DCWine, describing the non-conformity, either through the contact information provided or by email lanzarotedcwine@gmail.com. In addition, he will be responsible for the decrease in value of the products resulting from handling other than that necessary to establish the nature, characteristics and functioning of the goods. Likewise, the products must be returned using or including all their original packaging, and any other accompanying documents, as well as a copy of the purchase invoice. The User may return or send the products to DCWine at: Calle Chabusquillo (el), 35500 Arrecife (Las Palmas). The User will then be informed of their request within a maximum period of 10 days, offering them an appropriate solution. In any case, the rights recognized in the legislation in force at all times for the User, as a consumer and user, will always be observed.

Disclaimer of Liability

Unless otherwise provided by law, DCWine will not assume liability for:

list_1.li_1: Losses that are not attributable to any breach on your part.
list_1.li_2: Any business losses (including, without limitation, loss of profits, revenue, contracts, anticipated savings, data or goodwill) and any indirect loss or consequential damages which were not reasonably foreseeable at the time the contract was formed.

terms_and_conditions_page.after_list: DCWine also limits its liability in the following cases:

list_2.li_1: Product Display: All necessary measures are taken to faithfully display the products on the Website; however, DCWine will not be responsible for minor differences or inaccuracies due to screen resolution, browser or other similar problems.
list_2.li_2: Transport and delivery: DCWine acts with the utmost diligence. However, it is not responsible for delays, losses or thefts caused by incidents (including strikes, roadblocks, or other circumstances specific to the sector).
list_2.li_3: Improper use or incorrect return: DCWine shall not be liable for incorrect or negligent use of the product by the User, or for the return of the wrong item. It is the User's responsibility to ensure that the correct product is returned in accordance with the return instructions provided. DCWine shall also not be liable for any failure or delay in the fulfilment of obligations arising from force majeure events, including, but not limited to, strikes, lockouts or other protest measures; civil unrest, threats or acts of terrorism, war (declared or not), fire, explosion, flood, earthquake or other natural disasters, inability to use public or private transport and, in general, any cause beyond its reasonable control. In such cases, the obligations shall be deemed to be suspended for the duration of the force majeure event, with the deadline for their fulfilment being extended for a period equivalent to the duration of said cause. DCWine undertakes to use all reasonable means to find a solution that allows it to fulfil its obligations despite the force majeure event.

terms_and_conditions_page.last_paragraph:
In no event shall these limitations affect the statutory rights of the consumer, nor shall they be construed as an exclusion of liability in cases of gross negligence, wilful misconduct or any other case in which, by law, liability cannot be limited or excluded.

Waiver

No waiver by DCWine of any specific right or legal action or DCWine's failure to require strict performance by the User of any of its obligations shall constitute a waiver of any other rights or actions arising from a contract or the Conditions, nor shall it exonerate the User from compliance with its obligations. No waiver by DCWine of any of these Terms and Conditions or of any rights or actions arising from a contract shall be effective unless it is expressly stated to be a waiver and is formalized and communicated to the User in writing.

Nullity

If any of these Conditions were declared null and void by a final decision issued by a competent authority, the rest of the clauses will remain in force, without being affected by said declaration of nullity.

Complete Agreement

These Terms and Conditions and any document expressly referred to in them constitute the entire agreement between the User and DCWine in relation to the object of sale and replace any other pact, agreement or previous promise agreed verbally or in writing by the same parties. The User and DCWine acknowledge that they have agreed to enter into a contract without having relied on any statement or promise made by the other party, except for that which is expressly mentioned in these Terms and Conditions.

Data Protection

The information or personal data that the User provides to DCWine in the course of a transaction on the Website will be treated in accordance with the provisions of the Privacy Policy or data protection (contained, where applicable, in the Legal Notice). By accessing, browsing and/or using the Website, the User consents to the processing of said information and data and declares that all the information or data provided is true.

Applicable legislation and jurisdiction

Access, navigation and/or use of this Website and the contracts for the purchase of products through it shall be governed by Spanish law. Any controversy, problem or disagreement that arises or is related to the access, navigation and/or use of the Website, or with the interpretation and execution of these Terms and Conditions, or with the sales contracts between DCWine and the User, shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the Spanish courts and tribunals. Likewise, if a dispute arises from the conclusion of this purchase contract between DCWine and the User, the User as a consumer may request an extrajudicial solution to disputes, in accordance with Regulation (EU) 524/2013 of the European Parliament and of the Council, of May 21, 2013, on the resolution of online disputes in consumer matters and amending Regulation (EC) 2006/2004 and Directive 2009/22 / EC. You can access this method through the following website: https://ec.europa.eu/consumers/odr/.

Customer Service

We are here to help you. You can contact us through our channels.

cookies_policy_page.meta_description: Learn about how we use cookies to enhance your experience on DcWine and how you can control them.
cookies_policy_page.title: Cookies Policy
cookies_policy_page.description: A cookie is a file that is downloaded to your computer when you access certain web pages. Cookies allow a website, among other things, to store and retrieve information about the browsing habits of a user or their equipment and, depending on the information they contain and the way in which they use their equipment, they can be used to recognise the user. Cookies are essential for the functioning of the Internet, providing countless advantages in the provision of interactive services, facilitating navigation and usability of our website. The information we provide below will help you understand the different types of cookies:

rows.category: According to the entity that manages them
rows.description: These are those collected by the publisher itself to provide the service requested by the user.
These are those that are collected and managed by a third party; they cannot be considered as your own.

rows.category: DEPENDING ON THE TIME PERIOD THEY REMAIN ACTIVATED
rows.description: They collect data while the user browses the Internet in order to provide the requested service.
They are stored on the terminal and the information obtained will be used by the person responsible for the cookie in order to provide the requested service.
They are necessary for correct navigation on the website.
They allow the user the characteristics (language) for browsing the website.
They allow the provider to analyse the user's browsing, in order to monitor the use of the website and to compile statistics on the most visited content, number of visitors, etc.
They allow the publisher to include advertising spaces on the website, depending on the content of the website itself.
They allow the publisher to include advertising spaces on the website based on information obtained through the user's browsing habits.
